meanings.definition: The seven chief Anglo-Saxon kingdoms in England during the early Middle Ages.
meanings.sent1: The heptarchs ruled over different regions in England.
meanings.sent2: Historians study the heptarchs to understand early English history.
meanings.sent3: The heptarchs had a meeting to discuss trade agreements.
meanings.sent4: The heptarchs stood as pillars of power in the ancient lands.
meanings.sent5: Legends tell tales of the heptarchs' legendary battles.

meanings.definition: A group of seven rulers or leaders.
meanings.sent1: The heptarchs gathered to form an alliance.
meanings.sent2: The heptarchs each had their own strengths and weaknesses.
meanings.sent3: The heptarchs decided to go on a team-building retreat.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the heptarchs symbolized unity and strength.
meanings.sent5: The heptarchs' leadership inspired loyalty among their people.
